meanings.definition: Incorporates: to include or combine something as part of a whole
meanings.sent1: She incorpses fresh herbs into her cooking to enhance the flavors.
meanings.sent2: The recipe incorpses various spices to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to play a game where each ingredient incorpses into a secret recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity incorpses different colors to paint a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent5: The team incorpses individual talents to achieve success together.

meanings.definition: Incorporse: to become united or merged with something else
meanings.sent1: The two rivers incorpses at the delta and flow together as one.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the flavors of the stew incorpses into a rich and savory taste.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces incorpses seamlessly, revealing a complete picture.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship incorpses like two puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The music and lyrics incorpses beautifully, creating a moving song.
